data.name: Build numbers from chosen digits
data.description: Choose `n` digits from 0 ~ 9 as inputs, to construct a non-negative integer number of length `m`. Rules: - `n` is in range `[2, 10]`, m is in range `[1, 20]`. - `0` and `9` are always chosen. - Each input digit can be used any times (include 0 times). - Result number must end with `9`. - Any two adjacent digits of the number can't be the same. - The integer itself should not start with `0`, except `0` itself. Example: If `n` = 4, `m` = 5, and [`0`, `3`, `6`, `9`] are chosen, then: - `30639` is valid. - `96369` is valid. - `63309` is invalid, since there are two adjacent `3`. - `63090` is invalid, since it doesn't end with 9. The task is: Given `n` and `m`, choose `n` digits, find out how many distinct numbers of length `m` can be built, with only these `n` digits.
